subject: Re: [junit] Re: Newbie questions
msgSnippet: I think you are trying to make this way too hard from ... com.mystuff.test; import junit.framework.*; import com.mystuff.*; public class MyClassTest extends
messageBody:
I think you are trying to make this way too hard from
the outset.Here's a typical example:

-------------------------------------------------------package
com.mystuff.test;

import junit.framework.*;
import com.mystuff.*;

public class MyClassTest extends TestCase {

public MyClassTest(String name) {

super(name);
}

public static Test suite(){

return new TestSuite(MyClassTest.class);
}

public static void main(String[] args){
junit.swingui.TestRunner tr =
new junit.swingui.TestRunner();

tr.run(MyClassTest.class);
}

public void testCreation() {

MyClass aClass = new MyClass();

assertNotNull("aClass was null", aClass);
assertTrue("Should be been true",
aClass.someValue());
}
}

-------------------------------------------------------
package com.mystuff;

public class MyClass {

private boolean value = true;

public MyClass() {
}

public boolean someValue() {

return value;
}
}
-------------------------------------------------------

Hope this helps (sorry if the formatting sucks..using
a web client) ;)

-Eric
